intro: Pogonospermum salsola, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant in the Amaranthaceae family. It is a perennial shrub that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or saline soils. The plant has small, scale-like leaves that help reduce water loss, and its flowers are typically green or yellowish. It produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Pogonospermum salsola is adapted to harsh conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils in its native habitats.
